text: Ali Sidqi Azaykou (; 1942–2004), also called Dda Ali,« Hommage. Azayku l'Amazigh » par Maria Daïf, TelQuel n°147 . was a Moroccan Berber poet, historian, philosopher and critic. He was an Amazigh activist.Conscience et revendication de l'identité berbère. He has greatly influenced the cultural Berber movements.« Génération Amazigh » - HH / Tel Quel n° 184, août 2005. == Biography == Ali Sidqi Azaykou was born (1942) in the village of Igran n tuinght in the High Atlas in the surroundings of Taroudannt in the Sous region in Morocco.Claude Lefébure, Méditerranéennes n°11, hiver 1999/2000, Paris He began his primary education in his native village and ended them in Marrakesh where he also followed his secondary education and entered the national teacher training college. ==Books== * . Collection of Berber poetry. 1988. * . Éd. de la Faculté des Lettres, Kénitra, 1992. * . Collection of Berber poetry. Rabat, 1995. * . Recueil d'articles. Éd. Centre Tarik Ibn Zyad, Rabat, 2002. Introduction by Ahmed Toufiq. * , 2002. * , 2004. * , Éd. Annajah Al Jadida, 1993, Casablanca. ==Notes== Category:1942 births Category:2004 deaths Category:Berber writers Category:Berber Moroccans Category:Berber poets Category:Berber historians Category:Moroccan historians Category:Moroccan lexicographers Category:Moroccan literary critics Category:20th-century Moroccan poets Category:People from Taroudannt Category:People from Marrakesh Category:21st-century Moroccan poets Category:20th-century historians Category:Shilha people
title: Ali Azayku
